result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer A Beale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow transfer to Kenosha County.
Concurrent with: Count 2.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($253) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any JCPenny Store.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 06:00 p.m. on 01-24-2015.
Court will allow transfer to Kenosha County.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: Count 1, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Court costs ($253) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer A Beale

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 8/30/16 and filed by Department of Corrections seeking clarification of DNA surcharges.
Received and filed in court by the state.
Treatment Letter, received and filed by the defense.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jennifer A Beale in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.

Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:  
2 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Stayed

Term of Probation:  2 Years
Concurrent to count 2.
Court will allow transfer to Kenosha County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  any JCPenny's Store.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
DRGOD:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
5 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard conditions).
Defendant to report to the Huber Facility no later than 6:00 p.m. on:    01/24/15
Court will allow transfer to Kenosha County.



Count 2:
2 Month in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Consecutive to count 1.
Stayed

Term of Probation:  2 Years
Concurrent to count 1.
Conditions of Probation:
Same as Count 1.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
DRGOD:  $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Jennifer A Beale in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing, bound over. Information filed, reading waived.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for January 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 4, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/businesses at Brookfield Square Mall listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Jennifer A Beale in court with attorney Richard J. Smith.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:15 am.
